intro: Malleastrum longifoliolatum, commonly known as the long-leaved malleastrum, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish in color. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. Malleastrum longifoliolatum is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
